trans-unit.source: Provides a menu system for a form.
MenuStrip is the top-level container that supersedes <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MainMenu>.
It also provides key handling and multiple document interface (MDI) features.

Functionally, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem> work along with MenuStrip, although they are derived from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem>.

The following items are specifically designed to work seamlessly with both <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSystemRenderer> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripProfessionalRenderer> in all orientations.

They are available by default at design time for the MenuStrip control: - <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem> - <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripTextBox> - <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripComboBox> The MenuStrip control represents the container for the menu structure of a form.
You can add <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem> objects to the MenuStrip that represent the individual menu commands in the menu structure.
Each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem> can be a command for your application or a parent menu for other submenu items.

Although MenuStrip replaces and adds functionality to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MainMenu> control of previous versions, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MainMenu> is retained for both backward compatibility and future use if you choose.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip> to which you can add <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem> objects.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip"></xref> supports overflow functionality.
The overflow feature moves menu items to a drop-down menu when there is not enough room to display them in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip>.

When you set the CanOverflow property to `true`, you must also enable overflow for specific menu items by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem.Overflow%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
By default, menu items are not displayed if they cannot fit within the available space.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip"></xref> supports overflow functionality; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Creates a new accessibility object for the control.

If you do not explicitly call the CreateAccessibilityInstance method, it will be called when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibilityObject%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is referenced.

> [!NOTE] > To get or set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibilityObject%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, you must add a reference to the `Accessibility` assembly installed with the .NET Framework.
For a code example of using CreateAccessibilityInstance, see <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> for the control.
Creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem"></xref> with the specified text, image, and event handler on a new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip"></xref>.
Use the CreateDefaultItem method to add a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem> with commonly used characteristics to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip>.
The text to use for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem"></xref>.
If the `text` parameter is a hyphen (-), this method creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSeparator"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to display on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem"></xref>.
An event handler that raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click"></xref> event when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem"></xref> is clicked.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.Drawing.Image%2CSystem.EventHandler%29?displayProperty=fullName>, or a if the text parameter is a hyphen (-).
Gets the default spacing, in pixels, between the sizing grip and the edges of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip"></xref>.
<xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> values representing the spacing, in pixels.
Gets the spacing, in pixels, between the left, right, top, and bottom edges of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip"></xref> from the edges of the form.
Use the DefaultPadding property to set the interior space between controls.
When a control is a container of items, padding represents the space from the edge of the container.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> that represents the spacing.
The default is `{Left=6, Top=2, Right=0, Bottom=2}`.
Gets a value indicating whether ToolTips are shown for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip"></xref> by default.
The DefaultShowItemToolTips property always returns `false` because typically, ToolTips are not used for menus or menu items.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> in all cases.
Gets the horizontal and vertical dimensions, in pixels, of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip"></xref> when it is first created.
A <xref:System.Drawing.Point.%23ctor%2A> value representing the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip"></xref> horizontal and vertical dimensions, in pixels.
The default is 200 x 21 pixels.
Gets or sets the visibility of the grip used to reposition the control.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripGripStyle"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripGripStyle"></xref>.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem"></xref> that is used to display a list of Multiple-document interface (MDI) child forms.
Use the MdiWindowListItem property to designate or discover which <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem> displays MDI children.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip.MenuActivate> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip.MenuDeactivate> events on child menus to reflect changes to the value of MdiWindowListItem.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem"></xref> that represents the menu item displaying a list of MDI child forms that are open in the application.
Occurs when the user accesses the menu with the keyboard or mouse.

When activated by the ALT key, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> typically neither take nor remove the focus from the control that currently has the focus.
If there is a control hosted within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip> or a drop-down of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip>, the control gains focus when the user presses the TAB key.

In general, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.GotFocus>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.LostFocus>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Enter>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Leave> events of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip> might not be raised when they are activated by the keyboard.
In such cases, use the MenuActivate and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip.MenuDeactivate> events instead.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip"></xref> is deactivated.

When activated by the ALT key, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> typically neither take nor remove the focus from the control that currently has the focus.
If there is a control hosted within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip> or a drop-down of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip>, the control gains focus when the user presses the TAB key.

In general, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.GotFocus>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.LostFocus>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Enter>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Leave> events of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip> might not be raised when they are activated by the keyboard.
In such cases, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip.MenuActivate> and MenuDeactivate events instead.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip.MenuActivate"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnMenuActivate method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip.MenuDeactivate"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnMenuDeactivate method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Processes a command key.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref>, passed by reference, that represents the window message to process.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Keys"></xref> values that represents the key to process.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the character was processed by the control; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether ToolTips are shown for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip"></xref>.
The ShowItemToolTips property returns `false` by default because typically, ToolTips are not used for menus or menu items.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if ToolTips are shown for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip"></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip"></xref> stretches from end to end in its container.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MenuStrip"></xref> stretches from end to end in its container; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Processes Windows messages.
All messages are sent to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc%2A> method after getting filtered through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.PreProcessMessage%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc%2A> method corresponds exactly to the Windows `WindowProc` function.

For more information about processing Windows messages, see the `WindowProc` function documentation in the Windows Platform SDK reference located in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.
The Windows <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref> to process.
